intro: Stenocarpus laurinus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant. Stenocarpus laurinus is also valued for its ability to thrive in coastal environments, where it contributes to dune stabilization.
